name: Cook the Book: Cauliflower Prosciutto and Goat Cheese Gratin
description: If you’re still looking for another side dish for tomorrow’s feastivities, you’ve got to take a look at the cauliflower, prosciutto, and goat cheese gratin recipe from The Martha Stewart Living Cookbook: The New Classics. In the past, my dad...
recipeIngredient: 2 small heads cauliflower (about 3 pounds total), cut into 1-inch florets
1/4 cup homemade or low-sodium store-bought chicken stock, or water
Coarse salt and freshly ground pepper
3 ounces thinly sliced prosciutto (about 5 slices), coarsely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Butter a 2-quart casserole or an 8-inch-square baking dish; set aside. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the cauliflower; cook until just tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Drain.

Whisk together 8 ounces goat cheese and the orange juice, stock, thyme, flour, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper until smooth. Toss in the cauliflower and prosciutto. Spoon into the buttered dish. Top with the remaining 4 ounces goat cheese.
Cover with foil; bake 30 minutes. Remove the foil; bake until bubbling and just golden, about 30 minutes more. Let cool slightly before serving.
